title: ‘You guys got it wrong’: Rodney Harrison calls out Tony Dungy over Bill Belichick Hall of Fame snub
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rodney Harrison criticized Tony Dungy over Bill Belichick not being elected as a first-ballot Hall of Famer.
Tony Dungy explained the voting process, stating Roger Craig received more votes, while Belichick and Kraft were not chosen.
Harrison insisted Belichick is more deserving, citing his coaching impact, and disagreed with the committee's decision.

title: Jordon Hudson takes shot at Robert Kraft with controversial T-shirt
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jordon Hudson wore an 'Orchids of Asia' shirt at the UNC-Duke game with Bill Belichick.
The shirt references the salon involved in a 2019 prostitution sting linked to Robert Kraft.
Despite past legal issues, Kraft praised Belichick's Hall of Fame qualifications amid ongoing tensions.

title: Patriots Super Bowl LX live updates: Can Pats beat Seahawks to clinch title?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots aim for a record seventh Super Bowl win against the Seahawks at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara.
New England seeks to become the first NFL team to win a Super Bowl after a 4-13 season.
Game coverage available on NBC and 98.5 The Sports Hub, with kickoff at 6:30 p.m. EST.

title: Holy Cross dedicates court to Bob Cousy
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Holy Cross dedicated its basketball court to Bob Cousy, renaming it Bob Cousy '50 Court at the Hart Center.
Cousy, age 97, attended the ceremony, where Holy Cross defeated Lehigh 76-67.
Bill Simmons, Charlie Baker, and Karen Kenyatta Russell honored Cousy during the event in Worcester.

title: Healey proposes eliminating statute of limitations for rape when DNA evidence exists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey proposed eliminating the 15-year statute of limitations for rape cases in Massachusetts when DNA evidence exists.
The proposal includes a requirement to store sexual assault evidence kits for at least 15 years to preserve DNA evidence.
The measure is part of Healey's 2027 fiscal year budget and aligns with efforts to improve prosecution in sex crime cases.

title: Watch: Patriots share hype video ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: The New England Patriots released a hype video ahead of their Super Bowl LX match against the Seattle Seahawks.
Head Coach Mike Vrabel emphasized building a strong team identity and maximizing player potential in the video.
The video features highlights and motivational words from players, including wide receiver Stefon Diggs urging teammates to prove doubters wrong.

title: Former employee at Mass. post office pleads guilty after secretly recording female co-workers
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nicholas Testagrossa, 43, pleaded guilty to obstruction and video voyeurism after recording female co-workers at Westminster Post Office.
Hidden cameras placed in the women's restroom captured undressed co-workers, discovered by an employee on March 28, 2025.
Testagrossa faces up to 20 years in prison for obstruction, with sentencing scheduled for May 12, 2026.

title: Jewish groups sue Medford over values-based investment ordinance
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Two Jewish advocacy groups filed a federal lawsuit against Medford's values-based investment ordinance citing ideological divestment concerns.
The ordinance restricts taxpayer funds from being invested in industries like fossil fuels and alleged human rights violators.
The lawsuit argues the policy conflicts with Massachusetts law, prioritizing subjective criteria over financial returns and taxpayer rights.

title: Eight things Patriots must do to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots need MVP-level play from Drake Maye to overcome Seattle's strong defense in Super Bowl LX.
New England's defense aims to pressure Seahawks QB Sam Darnold, building on 12 sacks and 8 turnovers in playoffs.
Patriots plan to match Christian Gonzalez against Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba, the NFL Offensive Player of the Year.

title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest wore No. 55 at USC due to a tradition started by Junior Seau, and continued wearing it with the Patriots.
McGinest played with the Patriots from 1994-2005, appearing in four Super Bowls and becoming the team's second all-time sack leader.
After McGinest left the Patriots, Junior Seau joined and respectfully asked him for permission to wear the No. 55 jersey.
